1.title: Raindrop Rabbit
1.plot: When Bowie is captured while investigating a knock-off Knickknack company, the gang must fly to Meeskatania to save Bowie, and put an end to the knockoffs.

2.title: Dig It Dragon
2.plot: Bowie distracts a lovesick Jarvis with the task of updating a popular toy from the 1960s, while Piper gets stuck dating a guy who is unbearably upbeat.

3.title: Tinosaur
3.plot: When Knox pretends he's the president of Knickknack to impress his successful businessman father, Jarvis is willing to play along. Piper takes advantage of her "new boss" and uses the opportunity to clone a tiny dinosaur, which runs amok at Knickknack.

4.title: Wreck & Roll
4.plot: Piper attempts to get into a concert to show a famous punk rocker her new toy guitar. Meanwhile, Jarvis gets in over his head when he gets a tattoo to impress Piper.

5.title: Betty the Builder
5.plot: When Jarvis creates a construction worker doll for girls, based on a tough, real-life female construction worker without her permission, she shows up at Knickknack, looking for answers.

6.title: Joy Buzzer
6.plot: When Jarvis can't bring himself to tell Piper the cartoon she made is bad, he invents a fake film festival for her to enter it into. To keep up the charade, Jarvis enlists the rest of the gang to make short films.

7.title: Unicorpse
7.plot: When Jarvis writes and performs a cheesy love song for Piper, she assumes the song is meant for Geneva, and he is forced to cover by claiming Bowie wrote it.

8.title: Microphony
8.plot: Bowie uses a special microphone that mimics people's voices to secretly get Jarvis and Piper to confess their love for each other, but inadvertently causes a fight between the two.

9.title: My Last Dolly
9.plot: When Jarvis hires Candace to be in a focus group about toys for seniors, she and her daughter, Adelaide, hatch a plan to sabotage this new toy.

10.title: Ollie-Matic
10.plot: Jarvis holds a skateboarding competition where Knox's hero, Eric Thunder, goes head-to-head with Knickknack's new, self-driving skateboard: the Ollie-Matic.

11.title: Claude's Kitchen
11.plot: Jarvis duels against a snooty, French, celebrity kid chef in a cooking competition for Piper's affection.

12.title: Captain Indestructible
12.plot: Jarvis rehearses for a walk-on role in the new Captain Indestructible movie, while Piper protests the closing of the historic Punk club, the Viper Pit.

13.title: Mmmboing
13.plot: Jarvis and Piper are put to the test when a record producer discovers Piper and wants to send her away on a two-year tour.

21.title: The FunDom
21.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Strong Suit
1.plot: As the new owner of Knickknack Toys, Jarvis hires a group of kids from school to help him create awesome new toys.

2.title: Philharmonica
2.plot: The kids from Knickknack try to sell a kids' meal toy to Melody Burger by working undercover at the fast-food restaurant.

3.title: Pants Full of Ants
3.plot: Jarvis discovers Piper performing a love song called "Jarvis."

4.title: Rainbow Bunny
4.plot: Geneva accidentally orders one million Rainbow Bunny toys, so the gang creates a web show to encourage kids to buy them.

5.title: Kick the Can
5.plot: The team discovers a strange man inside the Knickknack building who claims to be Knickknack Toys' founder, P. Everett Knickknack.

6.title: Cupids Bow
6.plot: Piper invents a bow and arrow toy for Valentine's Day that makes the person hit with the arrow fall in love, and decides to try it out on Jarvis.

7.title: Dance Crew Evolution
7.plot: When P. Everett Knickknack passes away, Jarvis and Piper can't agree on how to best honour the strange man.

8.title: Angie
8.plot: Upset with the unrealistic standard of beauty exhibited by Knickknack Toys' Angie Doll, Piper convinces Jarvis to come up with an updated version.

9.title: Snack in the Box
9.plot: A challenge between Jarvis and Piper results in Geneva creating a horrifying toy to represent Knickknack at the Toy Innovator Awards.

10.title: Lobster Trap
10.plot: When Bowie invents a toy that allows kids to control video games with their minds and tests it on Jarvis, a malfunction makes Jarvis think he's a character in the game.

11.title: Teeny Toddler Chemistry Set
11.plot: When a kid shows up at Knickknack claiming that one of their toys blew up his house, Jarvis tries to do the right thing - even if that means letting the kid and his family move into the building.

12.title: Moosetrap
12.plot: After successfully suing Knickknack Toys, Bowie becomes the new owner of the company and decides to make a few changes.

13.title: Flycycle
13.plot: Jarvis and Piper must figure out a way to save Mrs. Bubkes from being recruited to fight in a war in her home country.

14.title: Ricky Van Felt
14.plot: Jarvis's irrational fear of puppets jeopardizes a deal between Knickknack Toys and beloved children's TV show Tickletown.

15.title: Flyrates
15.plot: At GameCon, Piper tricks Jarvis and Bowie into fighting in order to drum up interest in her new video game.

16.title: Fat Cat
16.plot: Knickknack is throwing a Fat Cat board game tournament but, on the day of the tournament, Candace steals all their Kitty Cash. Jarvis and the gang have to somehow get their cash out of a bank vault before the tournament starts.

17.title: Sidekick
17.plot: When the gang pitches their ideas for a brand new line of superhero toys, we see Piper, Aster and Jarvis's versions of who their superheroes - and their supervillains - would be.

18.title: Presto Pack
18.plot: When Jarvis accidentally exposes famed magician Sam Mazing's trick, the magicians in town band together and vow to hunt Jarvis down.

19.title: Very Scary Fairy Tales
19.plot: Jarvis sneaks Bowie into Genevas Party.

20.title: Realm of Raiders
20.plot: Piper has an online and in real life rivalry with someone.

21.title: Dr. KnickKnack's Medical Bag
21.plot: Jarvis decides to give Candace a second chance and hires her to be Mrs. Bubkes's assistant. But when a young girl uses a Knickknack toy to save a life, Candace sees it as a chance to regain the spotlight.

22.title: Pop Superstar
22.plot: When pop star Caden Clark hides from his crazed fans at KnickKnack Toys, he discovers he loves Knickknack's "Pop Superstar" video game - and decides to quit real superstardom to play the video game full-time.

23.title: Gizmospinatron
23.plot: In Jarvis's dream, he creates the world's greatest new toy - but now that he's woken up, he can't remember what it is. Piper, Bowie, and Aster try to recreate the events of the day to help Jarvis have the same dream again.

24.title: Mmmbomb
24.plot: When Mmmboing bounces into Prime Minister Davenport on TV, Davenport tracks the ball back to Bowie - and forces the kids to help him use Mmmboing's technology for his own purposes.

25.title: Everyball
25.plot: When Jarvis buys commercial time during the Super Bowl, he gets two tickets to the big game and everyone wants to go with him.

26.title: Junior Fish Gutter
26.plot: To find out if Jarvis has any real feelings for her, Piper pretends she's been offered a new job at a toy company far, far away.

1.title: Bouncy Pants
1.plot: When Mrs. Bubkes is named Vice-President of Knickknack Toys, Candace attempts to use the opportunity to sabotage their latest toy release and take down the company for good.

2.title: Ruff Rider
2.plot: To promote Ruff Rider, the ride-on car for dogs, Jarvis holds a dog competition. But when the prize turns out to be a dog collar worn by one of Piper's favorite punk singers, she is willing to do anything to get that collar - even compete in the Knickknack Toys Dogcathlon.

3.title: Just Like a Baby
3.plot: When Mrs. Bubkes realizes the kids are always willing to help out a pregnant woman, she fakes a pregnancy - leading the gang to want to meet Mr. Bubkes.

4.title: Samurai Salamanders
4.plot: Knickknack holds an event to release limited-edition Samurai Salamander toys in conjunction with the release of the blockbuster movie, and one young, die-hard fan is convinced Jarvis and the gang in costume are the real Salamanders. When the kid has his limited-edition toy stolen by a bully and asks the Samurai Salamanders if they'll get it back, they have no choice but to agree. But they soon discover this so-called bully is actually a full-grown biker, with full-grown biker friends, who have plans to make Knickknack their new hangout.

5.title: Brrrzooka
5.plot: When Mrs. Bubkes is named Vice-President of Knickknack Toys, Candace attempts to use the opportunity to sabotage their latest toy release and take down the company for good.

6.title: Cardboard Box
6.plot: Piper starts a band at Knickknack. But when she loses creative control of the project to Geneva, she ends up quitting her own band.

7.title: Flurf
7.plot: When Jarvis branches out into the mattress business, he accidentally lands Knickknack in a war with local business rival, Mel's Mattress Kingdom.

8.title: Littlefoot
8.plot: When Jarvis and Bowie post a video of Aster wearing a high-fashion fur suit and digging through a dumpster online, viewers mistake Aster for the legendary, mythological cryptid creature, "Littlefoot." With Littlefoot mania in full swing, Jarvis creates a line of Littlefoot toys, planning to promote them by making more videos of Aster without his knowing. But when Littlefoot toy sales drop, Jarvis decides it's time to up the ante by staging, and recording, a Littlefoot attack.

9.title: Wind-Up Robot
9.plot: The news that a vintage toy worth a million dollars is hidden somewhere in their building unleashes "gold fever" among the Knickknack gang.

10.title: Kooky-Dough
10.plot: When Candace vows to send a safety inspector to inspect Knickknack Toys, Jarvis goes above and beyond with his safety protocols. But the one thing he didn't account for was an out-of-control man-eating toy dough.

11.title: Greedy Pig
11.plot: Knickknack releases a new toy: Greedy Pig, the piggy bank that makes saving fun. But when the gang discovers the money that kids are saving in their Greedy Pigs is somehow disappearing, it's time for a stakeout to find the thief.

12.title: Stinky Face
12.plot: Dissatisfied with how she's treated, Piper goes undercover as a blonde to prove it's really true that blondes have more fun.

13.title: Snappo
13.plot: The founder of building block company. Snappo, visits Knickknack and says he wants Jarvis to take over his empire. But is Tobias Blaabjerg everything he seems?

14.title: Rocket with a Pocket
14.plot: After accidentally trapping Mmmboing, the gang decides to launch him into outer space and finally be rid of him forever. Once the mission is a success, Jarvis realizes they have a great toy on their hands: Rocket with a Pocket, the time capsule that can send your favourite object into space. But when a kid uses the toy to launch her baby sister into space, the gang has to figure out a way to retrieve the rocket before it's too late.

15.title: The Shnorfs
15.plot: Piper updates one of the Shnorfs, a gnome-like figurine, by making it walk, talk, and giving it Jarvis's personality. Soon Piper realizes she can use Shnorf Jarvis to figure out how to make the real Jarvis fall in love with her.

16.title: Award Show in a Box
16.plot: When Hollywood starlet Jazlyn Simms drops by Knickknack to meet the designer behind her doll's dresses, Jarvis takes credit for designs that aren't his.

17.title: K-Kube
17.plot: When Jarvis discovers Geneva is a K-Kube puzzle-solving wiz, he seizes the opportunity to boost K-Kube sales by holding a competition between Geneva and Kubot, the robot designed to solve the cube puzzle in record time.

18.title: Taste Buds
18.plot: After lying to Piper by telling her that Jarvis is in love with her, Bowie struggles to keep Jarvis and Piper apart before Piper spills the beans and Bowie gets caught in his lie.

-1.title: Wreck & Roll
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.title: Some Assembly Required
plot: A 14-year-old takes ownership of a toy company and hires a group of his friends to help him create amazing new toys.::Jovannah Trimble
synopsis: When fourteen-year-old Jarvis Raines gets a chemistry set from his Aunt Marlene for Christmas, he assumes it's just another boring gift. Boy is he wrong! The contents create a chemical reaction that destroys his houseso much for a Merry Christmas! After getting not even an apology from the manufacturer, Knickknack Toys, Jarvis takes them to court, wins, and ends up owning the company!Surrounded by doubters, including the former owner, a tough-as-nails businesswoman named Candace Wheeler, Jarvis decides to prove to the world that he can not only run the company, he can make it better than ever! Jarvis wants to once again make Knickknack Toys the beloved brand it once was and restore honour to the name of the company's founder, P. Everett Knickknack. (Even if that founder is a fictional cartoon character)If Jarvis is going to succeed, he's going to have to invent some of the most exciting, fun, and creative toys in history. And he's is going to need a lot of help to pull it off. Running a toy company is going to take more than a fourteen-year-old kid. It's going to take six fourteen-year-old kids. Of course, putting together the right team won't be easy. There will be Some Assembly Required.
